     187             : // DQ (1/16/2008): This function was moved from the commandling_processing.C file to support the debugging specific to binary analysis
     188             : /* This function not only looks at the file name, but also checks that the file exists, can be opened for reading, and has
     189             :  * specific values for its first two bytes. Checking the first two bytes here means that each time we add support for a new
     190             :  * magic number in the binary parsers we have to remember to update this list also.  Another problem is that the binary
     191             :  * parsers understand a variety of methods for neutering malicious binaries -- transforming them in ways that make them
     192             :  * unrecognized by the operating system on which they're intended to run (and thus unrecongizable also by this function).
     193             :  * Furthermore, CommandlineProcessing::isBinaryExecutableFile() contains similar magic number checking. [RPM 2010-01-15] */

     651             : void
     652         355 : SgProject::processCommandLine(const vector<string>& input_argv)
     653             :    {
     654             :   // This functions only copies the command line and extracts information from the
     655             :   // command line which is useful at the SgProject level (other information useful
     656             :   // at the SgFile level is not extracted).
     657             :   // Specifically:
     658             :   //      1) --help is processed (along with -help, to be friendly)
     659             :   //      2) -o <filename> is processed (since both the compilation and the linking
     660             :   //         phases must know the output file name and it makes sense to process that once).
     661             :   //      3) Lists of files and libraries are processed (sense they too are required in
     662             :   //         both compilation and linking).  (e.g. -l<libname>, -L <directory>, <libname>.a,
     663             :   //         <filename>.C, <filename>.c, -I<directory name>, <filename>.h
     664             :   // NOTE: there is no side-effect to argc and argv.  Thus the original ROSE translator can
     665             :   // see all options.  Any ROSE or EDG specific options can be striped by calling the
     666             :   // appropriate functions to strip them out.
     667             : 
     668             :   // This function now makes an internal copy of the command line parameters to
     669             :   // allow the originals to remain unmodified (SLA modifies the command line).
     670             : 
     671             : #if 0
     672             :      printf ("Inside of SgProject::processCommandLine() \n");

    1095             :   // DQ (9/14/2013): Adding option to copy the location of the input file as the position for the generated output file.
    1096             :   // This is now demonstrated to be important in the case of ffmpeg-1.2 for the file "file.c" where it is specified as
    1097             :   // "libavutil/file.c" on the command line and we by default put it into the current directory (top level directory
    1098             :   // in the directory structure).  But it is a subtle and difficult to reproduce error that the generated file will
    1099             :   // not compile properly from the top level directory (even when the "-I<absolute path>/libavutil" is specified).
    1100             :   // We need an option to put the generated file back into the original directory where the input source files is
    1101             :   // located, so that when the generated rose_*.c file is compiled (with the backend compiler, e.g. gcc) it can use
    1102             :   // the identical rules for resolving head files as it would have for the original input file (had it been compiled
    1103             :   // using the backend compiler instead).
    1104         354 :      set_unparse_in_same_directory_as_input_file(false);

    1711         355 :   std::vector<std::string> r_argv;
    1712             : 
    1713         355 :   bool looking_for_include_path_arg = false;
    1714        5208 :   BOOST_FOREACH(std::string arg, argv)
    1715             :   {
    1716             :       // Must be first since there could be, for example, "-I -I",
    1717             :       // in which case, the else if branch checking for -I would
    1718             :       // be entered.
    1719        3242 :       if (looking_for_include_path_arg)
    1720             :       {
    1721           0 :           looking_for_include_path_arg = false; // reset for next iteration
    1722             : 
    1723             :           // Sanity check
    1724           0 :           bool is_directory = boost::filesystem::is_directory(arg);
    1725           0 :           if (false == is_directory)
    1726             :           {
    1727             :           // DQ (3/15/2017): Fixed to use mlog message logging.
    1728           0 :              if (Rose::ir_node_mlog[Rose::Diagnostics::DEBUG])
    1729             :                 {
    1730           0 :                   std::cout  << "[WARN] "
    1731             :                         << "Invalid argument to -I; path does not exist: "
    1732           0 :                         << "'" << arg << "'"
    1733           0 :                         << std::endl;
    1734             :                 }
    1735             :           }
    1736             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    1737             :           // ensure that the path is quoted on Windows.
    1738             :           r_argv.push_back("-I\"" + arg + "\"");
    1739             : #else
    1740           0 :           r_argv.push_back("-I" + arg + "");
    1741             : #endif
    1742             :       }
    1743        3242 :       else if ((arg.size() >= 2) && (arg[0] == '-') && (arg[1] == 'I'))
    1744             :       {
    1745             :           // -I <path>: There is a space between the option and the argument...
    1746             :           //   ^
    1747             :           //
    1748             :           // ...meaning this current argument is exactly "-I".
    1749             :           //
    1750         281 :           if (arg.size() == 2)
    1751             :           {
    1752           0 :               looking_for_include_path_arg = true;
    1753           0 :               continue; // next iteration should be the path argument
    1754             :           }
    1755             :           else
    1756             :           {
    1757             :               // no normalization required for -I<path>, but ensure
    1758             :               // that the path is quoted on Windows.

    1760             :               if (arg[2] != '"')
    1761             :               {

    2196             : /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    2199             : void
    2200           0 : SgFile::usage ( int status )
    2201             :    {
    2202           0 :      if (status != 0)
    2203           0 :           fprintf (stderr,"Try option `--help' for more information.\n");
    2204             :        else
    2205             :         {
    2206             :        // it would be nice to insert the version of ROSE being used (using the VERSION macro)
    2207           0 :           fputs(
    2208             : "\n"
    2209             : "This ROSE translator provides a means for operating on C, C++, and Fortran source code.\n"
    2210             : "\n"
    2211             : "Usage: rose [OPTION]... FILENAME...\n"
    2212             : "\n"
    2213             : "If a long option shows a mandatory argument, it is mandatory for the equivalent\n"
    2214             : "short option as well, and similarly for optional arguments.\n"
    2215             : "\n"
    2216             : "Main operation mode:\n"
    2217             : "     -rose:(o|output) FILENAME\n"
    2218             : "                             file containing final unparsed C++ code\n"
    2219             : "                             (relative or absolute paths are supported)\n"
    2220             : "     -rose:keep_going\n"
    2221             : "                             Similar to GNU Make's --keep-going option.\n"
    2222             : "\n"
    2223             : "                             If ROSE encounters an error while processing your\n"
    2224             : "                             input code, ROSE will simply run your backend compiler on\n"
    2225             : "                             your original source code file, as is, without modification.\n"
    2226             : "\n"
    2227             : "                             This is useful for compiler tests. For example,\n"
    2228             : "                             when compiling a 100K LOC application, you can\n"
    2229             : "                             try to compile as much as possible, ignoring failures,\n"
    2230             : "                             in order to gauage the overall status of your translator,\n"
    2231             : "                             with respect to that application.\n"
    2232             : "\n"
    2233             : "Operation modifiers:\n"
    2234             : "     -rose:output_warnings   compile with warnings mode on\n"
    2235             : "     -rose:C_only, -rose:C   follow C89 standard, disable C++\n"
    2236             : "     -rose:C89_only, -rose:C89\n"
    2237             : "                             follow C89 standard, disable C++\n"
    2238             : "     -rose:C99_only, -rose:C99\n"
    2239             : "                             follow C99 standard, disable C++\n"
    2240             : "     -rose:C11_only, -rose:C11\n"
    2241             : "                             follow C11 standard, disable C++\n"
    2242             : "     -rose:C14_only, -rose:C14\n"
    2243             : "                             follow C14 standard, disable C++\n"
    2244             : "     -rose:Cxx_only, -rose:Cxx\n"
    2245             : "                             follow C++89 standard\n"
    2246             : "     -rose:Cxx11_only, -rose:Cxx11\n"
    2247             : "                             follow C++11 standard\n"
    2248             : "     -rose:Cxx14_only, -rose:Cxx14\n"
    2249             : "                             follow C++14 standard\n"
    2250             : "     -rose:OpenMP, -rose:openmp\n"
    2251             : "                             follow OpenMP 3.0 specification for C/C++ and Fortran, perform one of the following actions:\n"
    2252             : "     -rose:OpenMP:parse_only, -rose:openmp:parse_only\n"
    2253             : "                             parse OpenMP directives to OmpAttributes, no further actions (default behavior now)\n"
    2254             : "     -rose:OpenMP:ast_only, -rose:openmp:ast_only\n"
    2255             : "                             on top of -rose:openmp:parse_only, build OpenMP AST nodes from OmpAttributes, no further actions\n"
    2256             : "     -rose:OpenMP:lowering, -rose:openmp:lowering\n"
    2257             : "                             on top of -rose:openmp:ast_only, transform AST with OpenMP nodes into multithreaded code \n"
    2258             : "                             targeting GCC GOMP runtime library\n"
    2259             : "     -rose:fortran\n"
    2260             : "                             compile Fortran code, determining version of\n"
    2261             : "                             Fortran from file suffix)\n"
    2262             : "     -rose:CoArrayFortran, -rose:CAF, -rose:caf\n"
    2263             : "                             compile Co-Array Fortran code (extension of Fortran 2003)\n"
    2264             : "     -rose:CAF2.0, -rose:caf2.0\n"
    2265             : "                             compile Co-Array Fortran 2.0 code (Rice CAF extension)\n"
    2266             : "     -rose:Fortran2003, -rose:F2003, -rose:f2003\n"
    2267             : "                             compile Fortran 2003 code\n"
    2268             : "     -rose:Fortran95, -rose:F95, -rose:f95\n"
    2269             : "                             compile Fortran 95 code\n"
    2270             : "     -rose:Fortran90, -rose:F90, -rose:f90\n"
    2271             : "                             compile Fortran 90 code\n"
    2272             : "     -rose:Fortran77, -rose:F77, -rose:f77\n"
    2273             : "                             compile Fortran 77 code\n"
    2274             : "     -rose:Fortran66, -rose:F66, -rose:f66\n"
    2275             : "                             compile Fortran 66 code\n"
    2276             : "     -rose:FortranIV, -rose:FIV, -rose:fIV\n"
    2277             : "                             compile Fortran IV code\n"
    2278             : "     -rose:FortranII, -rose:FII, -rose:fII\n"
    2279             : "                             compile Fortran II code (not implemented yet)\n"
    2280             : "     -rose:FortranI, -rose:FI, -rose:fI\n"
    2281             : "                             compile Fortran I code (not implemented yet)\n"
    2282             : "     -rose:fortran:ofp:jvm_options\n"
    2283             : "                             Specifies the JVM startup options\n"
    2284             : "     -rose:strict            strict enforcement of ANSI/ISO standards\n"
    2285             : "     -rose:projectSpecificDatabaseFile FILE\n"
    2286             : "                             filename where a database of all files used in a project are stored\n"
    2287             : "                             for producing unique trace ids and retrieving the reverse mapping from trace to files"
    2288             : "     -rose:compilationPerformance\n"
    2289             : "                             Output compilation performance after compilation of input file.\n"
    2290             : "                             Reports internal phases of ROSE compilation (time and memory requirements), output to stdout.\n"
    2291             : "                             See also \"-rose:compilationPerformanceFile FILE\" for CSV report in a file.\n"
    2292             : "     -rose:compilationPerformanceFile FILE\n"
    2293             : "                             filename where compiler performance for internal\n"
    2294             : "                             phases (in CSV form) is placed for later\n"
    2295             : "                             processing (using script/graphPerformance)\n"
    2296             : "     -rose:exit_after_parser just call the parser (C, C++, and fortran only)\n"
    2297             : "     -rose:skip_syntax_check skip Fortran syntax checking (required for F2003 and Co-Array Fortran code\n"
    2298             : "                             when using gfortran versions greater than 4.1)\n"
    2299             : "     -rose:relax_syntax_check skip Fortran syntax checking (required for some F90 code\n"
    2300             : "                             when using gfortran based syntax checking)\n"
    2301             : "     -rose:skip_translation_from_edg_ast_to_rose_ast\n"
    2302             : "                             skip the translation of the EDG AST into the ROSE AST\n"
    2303             : "                             (an SgProject, SgFile, and empty SgGlobal will be constructed)\n"
    2304             : "     -rose:skip_transformation\n"
    2305             : "                             read input file and skip all transformations\n"
    2306             : "     -rose:skip_unparse      read and process input file but skip generation of\n"
    2307             : "                             final C++ output file\n"
    2308             : "     -rose:skipfinalCompileStep\n"
    2309             : "                             read and process input file, \n"
    2310             : "                             but skip invoking the backend compiler\n"
    2311             : "     -rose:collectAllCommentsAndDirectives\n"
    2312             : "                             store all comments and CPP directives in header\n"
    2313             : "                             files into the AST\n"
    2314             : "     -rose:unparseHeaderFiles\n"
    2315             : "                             unparse all directly or indirectly modified\n"
    2316             : "                             header files\n"
    2317             : "     -rose:excludeCommentsAndDirectives PATH\n"
    2318             : "                             provide path to exclude when using the\n"
    2319             : "                             collectAllCommentsAndDirectives option\n"
    2320             : "     -rose:excludeCommentsAndDirectivesFrom FILENAME\n"
    2321             : "                             provide filename to file with paths to exclude\n"
    2322             : "                             when using the collectAllCommentsAndDirectives\n"
    2323             : "                             option\n"
    2324             : "     -rose:includeCommentsAndDirectives PATH\n"
    2325             : "                             provide path to include when using the\n"
    2326             : "                             collectAllCommentsAndDirectives option\n"
    2327             : "     -rose:includeCommentsAndDirectivesFrom FILENAME\n"
    2328             : "                             provide filename to file with paths to include\n"
    2329             : "                             when using the collectAllCommentsAndDirectives\n"
    2330             : "                             option\n"
    2331             : "     -rose:skip_commentsAndDirectives\n"
    2332             : "                             ignore all comments and CPP directives (can\n"
    2333             : "                             generate (unparse) invalid code if not used with\n"
    2334             : "                             -rose:unparse_includes)\n"
    2335             : "     -rose:prelink           activate prelink mechanism to force instantiation\n"
    2336             : "                             of templates and assignment to files\n"
    2337             : "     -rose:instantiation XXX control template instantiation\n"
    2338             : "                             XXX is one of (none, used, all, local)\n"
    2339             : "     -rose:read_executable_file_format_only\n"
    2340             : "                             ignore disassemble of instructions (helps debug binary \n"
    2341             : "                             file format for binaries)\n"
    2342             : "     -rose:skipAstConsistancyTests\n"
    2343             : "                             skip AST consitancy testing (for better performance)\n"
    2344             : "     -rose:no_optimize_flag_for_frontend\n"
    2345             : "                             ignore use of __builtin functions in frontend processing\n"
    2346             : "                             all optimization specified is still done on ROSE generated code\n"
    2347             : "\n"
    2348             : "AST I/O:\n"
    2349             : "     -rose:ast:read in1.ast,in2.ast\n"
    2350             : "                             Comma-separated list of input AST files (extension does *not* matter).\n"
    2351             : "                             Evaluated when the frontend finishes (before merge and plugins).\n"
    2352             : "     -rose:ast:write out.ast\n"
    2353             : "                             Output AST file (extension does *not* matter).\n"
    2354             : "                             Evaluated in the backend before any file unparsing or backend compiler calls.\n"
    2355             : "     -rose:ast:merge         Merges ASTs from different source files (always true when -rose:ast:read is used)\n"
    2356             : "\n"
    2357             : "AST to GraphViz:\n"
    2358             : "     -rose:ast:graphviz:when off|frontend|backend|both\n"
    2359             : "                             When to generate the graph (off by default).\n"
    2360             : "                             \"frontend\" refers to after the frontend but before any midend (or plugin) runs.\n"
    2361             : "                                  It shows the AST as it was read.\n"
    2362             : "                             \"backend\" refers to after all midend (or plugin) have been run.\n"
    2363             : "                                  It shows the AST as it will be unparsed.\n"
    2364             : "     -rose:ast:graphviz:mode tree|graph\n"
    2365             : "                             Whether to generate the basic AST or the complete graph (AST + symbols + types)\n"
    2366             : "                             The graph mode will show *all* nodes: you must use self-contained reproducers\n"
    2367             : "                                 (using -DSKIP_ROSE_BUILTIN_DECLARATIONS -- can be multiple source/header but no system headers).\n"
    2368             : "     -rose:ast:graphviz:out rose-ast-frontend.dot,rose-ast-backend.dot\n"
    2369             : "                             Name of the output file (comma separted files if when=both).\n"
    2370             : "                             Default is rose-ast.dot if when is not both, else it is rose-ast-frontend.dot and rose-ast-backend.dot\n"
    2371             : "\n"
    2372             : "AST checking:\n"
    2373             : "     -rose:ast:checker:when off|frontend|backend|both\n"
    2374             : "                             When to check the AST (off by default).\n"
    2375             : "                             \"frontend\" refers to after the frontend but before any midend (or plugin) runs.\n"
    2376             : "                                  It checks the AST as it was read.\n"
    2377             : "                             \"backend\" refers to after all midend (or plugin) have been run.\n"
    2378             : "                                  It checks the AST as it will be unparsed.\n"
    2379             : "     -rose:ast:checker:mode ll,ast\n"
    2380             : "                             Comma-separated selection of checkers:\n"
    2381             : "                               * ll: low-level AST checks (pointer validity)\n"
    2382             : "                               * ast: construction rules (such as declarations, symbols, and types graphs)\n"
    2383             : "                             Default is \"ll,ast\"\n"
    2384             : "     -rose:ast:checker:effect none|summary|report|fail\n"
    2385             : "                             Control the effect of detecting defect:.\n"
    2386             : "                               * none: no visible effect but log/save might still get triggered.\n"
    2387             : "                               * summary|report: display a summary or full log on std::cerr.\n"
    2388             : "                               * fail: display a summary on std::cerr then abort.\n"
    2389             : "     -rose:ast:checker:log filename.log\n"
    2390             : "                             Output log file *iff* any defect is found (no log if missing).\n"
    2391             : "                             Comma separated if when=both.\n"
    2392             : "     -rose:ast:checker:save filename\n"
    2393             : "                             Causes the whole AST and check results to be saved as filename.ast and filename.json.\n"
    2394             : "                             *iff* any defect is found.\n"
    2395             : "                             Comma separated if when=both.\n"
    2396             : "\n"
    2397             : "Plugin Mode:\n"
    2398             : "     -rose:plugin_lib <shared_lib_filename>\n"
    2399             : "                             Specify the file path to a shared library built from plugin source files \n"
    2400             : "                             This option can repeat multiple times to load multiple libraries \n"
    2401             : "     -rose:plugin_action <act_name>\n"
    2402             : "                             Specify the plugin action to be executed\n"
    2403             : "                             This option can repeat multiple times to execute multiple actions \n"
    2404             : "                             in the order shown up in command line \n"
    2405             : "     -rose:plugin_arg_<act_name>  <option>\n"
    2406             : "                             Specify one option to be passed to a plugin named act_name\n"
    2407             : "                             This option can repeat multiple times to provide multiple options to a plugin \n"
    2408             : "\n"
    2409             : "GNU g++ options recognized:\n"
    2410             : "     -ansi                   equivalent to -rose:strict\n"
    2411             : "     -fno-implicit-templates disable output of template instantiations in\n"
    2412             : "                             generated source\n"
    2413             : "     -fno-implicit-inline-templates\n"
    2414             : "                             disable output of inlined template instantiations\n"
    2415             : "                             in generated source\n"
    2416             : "     -S                      gnu option trivial\n"
    2417             : "     -u (-undefined)         gnu option trivial\n"
    2418             : "     -version-info <name>    gnu option trivial (option not passed on to linker yet, \n"
    2419             : "                             incomplete implementation)\n"
    2420             : "     -MM <filename>          gnu Makefile dependence generation (option not passed \n"
    2421             : "                             on to compiler yet, incomplete implementation)\n"
    2422             : "\n"
    2423             : "Informative output:\n"
    2424             : "     -rose:help, --help, -help, --h\n"
    2425             : "                             print this help, then exit\n"
    2426             : "     -rose:version, --version, --V\n"
    2427             : "                             print ROSE program version number, then exit\n"
    2428             : "     -rose:markGeneratedFiles\n"
    2429             : "                             add \"#define ROSE_GENERATED_CODE\" to top of all\n"
    2430             : "                               generated code\n"
    2431             : "     -rose:verbose [LEVEL]   verbosely list internal processing (default=0)\n"
    2432             : "                               Higher values generate more output (can be\n"
    2433             : "                               applied to individual files and to the project\n"
    2434             : "                               separately).\n"
    2435             : "     -rose:log WHAT\n"
    2436             : "                             Control diagnostic output. See '-rose:log help' for\n"
    2437             : "                             more information.\n"
    2438             : "     -rose:assert HOW\n"
    2439             : "                             Determines how a failed assertion is handled. The value\n"
    2440             : "                             for HOW should be 'abort', 'exit' with non-zero status, or\n"
    2441             : "                             'throw' a Rose::Diagnostics::FailedAssertion exception. Only\n"
    2442             : "                             assertions that use the Sawyer mechanism are affected.\n"
    2443             : "     -rose:output_parser_actions\n"
    2444             : "                             call parser with --dump option (fortran only)\n"
    2445             : "     -rose:embedColorCodesInGeneratedCode LEVEL\n"
    2446             : "                             embed color codes into generated output for\n"
    2447             : "                               visualization of highlighted text using tview\n"
    2448             : "                               tool for constructs specified by LEVEL\n"
    2449             : "                             LEVEL is one of:\n"
    2450             : "                               1: missing position information\n"
    2451             : "                               2: compiler-generated code\n"
    2452             : "                               3: other code\n"
    2453             : "     -rose:generateSourcePositionCodes LEVEL\n"
    2454             : "                             generate separate file of source position\n"
    2455             : "                               information for highlighting original source\n"
    2456             : "                               file using tview tool for constructs specified\n"
    2457             : "                               by LEVEL\n"
    2458             : "                             LEVEL is one of:\n"
    2459             : "                               1: statements, preprocessor directives and\n"
    2460             : "                                  comments\n"
    2461             : "                               2: expressions\n"
    2462             : "\n"
    2463             : "Control EDG frontend processing:\n"
    2464             : "     -edg:new_frontend       force use of external EDG front end (disables use\n"
    2465             : "                               of rest of ROSE/SAGE)\n"
    2466             : "     -edg:KCC_frontend       for use of KCC (with -c option) as new frontend\n"
    2467             : "                               (must be specified with -edg:new_frontend)\n"
    2468             : "     -edg:XXX                pass  -XXX to EDG front-end\n"
    2469             : "    --edg:XXX                pass --XXX to EDG front-end\n"
    2470             : "     -edg_parameter: XXX YYY pass  -XXX YYY to EDG front-end (note: space after colon is required)\n"
    2471             : "    --edg_parameter: XXX YYY pass --XXX YYY to EDG front-end (note: space after colon is required)\n"
    2472             : "\n"
    2473             : "Control Fortran frontend processing:\n"
    2474             : "     -rose:cray_pointer_support\n"
    2475             : "                             turn on internal support for cray pointers\n"
    2476             : "                             (Note: not implemented in front-end (OFP) yet.)\n"
    2477             : "     -fortran:XXX            pass -XXX to independent semantic analysis\n"
    2478             : "                             (useful for turning on specific warnings in front-end)\n"
    2479             : "\n"
    2480             : "Control code generation:\n"
    2481             : "     -rose:unparser:clobber_input_file\n"
    2482             : "                               **CAUTION**RED*ALERT**CAUTION**\n"
    2483             : "                               If you don't know what this option does, don't use it!\n"
    2484             : "                               We are not responsible for any mental or physical damage\n"
    2485             : "                               that you will incur with the use of this option :)\n"
    2486             : "\n"
    2487             : "                               Note: This option breaks parallel builds, so make sure\n"
    2488             : "                               that with this option you use ROSE, and run your build\n"
    2489             : "                               system, sequentially.\n"
    2490             : "                               **CAUTION**RED*ALERT**CAUTION**\n"
    2491             : "     -rose:unparse_line_directives\n"
    2492             : "                               unparse statements using #line directives with\n"
    2493             : "                               reference to the original file and line number\n"
    2494             : "                               to support view of original source in debuggers\n"
    2495             : "                               and external tools\n"
    2496             : "     -rose:unparse_function_calls_using_operator_syntax\n"
    2497             : "                               unparse overloaded operators using operator syntax\n"
    2498             : "                               relevant to C++ only (default is to reproduce use\n"
    2499             : "                               defined by the input code).\n"
    2500             : "     -rose:unparse_function_calls_using_operator_names\n"
    2501             : "                               unparse overloaded operators using operator names \n"
    2502             : "                               (not operator syntax) relevant to C++ only (default\n"
    2503             : "                               is to reproduce use defined by the input code).\n"
    2504             : "     -rose:unparse_instruction_addresses\n"
    2505             : "                               Outputs the addresses in left column (output\n"
    2506             : "                               inappropriate as input to assembler)\n"
    2507             : "     -rose:unparse_raw_memory_contents\n"
    2508             : "                               Outputs memory contents in left column\n"
    2509             : "     -rose:unparse_binary_file_format\n"
    2510             : "                               Outputs binary executable file format information\n"
    2511             : "     -rose:unparse_includes\n"
    2512             : "                               unparse all include files into the source file.\n"
    2513             : "                               This is a backup option for fail-safe processing\n"
    2514             : "                               of CPP directives (which can be tricky)\n"
    2515             : "     -rose:C_output_language\n"
    2516             : "                             force use of C as output language (currently\n"
    2517             : "                               generates C/C++)\n"
    2518             : "     -rose:Cxx_output_language\n"
    2519             : "                             force use of C++ as output language\n"
    2520             : "     -rose:Fortran_output_language\n"
    2521             : "                             force use of Fortran as output language\n"
    2522             : "     -rose:outputFormat      generate code in either fixed/free format (fortran only)\n"
    2523             : "                               options are: fixedOutput|fixedFormatOutput or \n"
    2524             : "                                            freeOutput|freeFormatOutput\n"
    2525             : "     -rose:backendCompileFormat\n"
    2526             : "                             use backend compiler option to compile generated code\n"
    2527             : "                               in either fixed/free format (fortran only)\n"
    2528             : "                               options are: fixedOutput|fixedFormatOutput or \n"
    2529             : "                                            freeOutput|freeFormatOutput\n"
    2530             : "     -rose:unparseHeaderFilesRootFolder FOLDERNAME\n"
    2531             : "                             A relative or an absolute path to the root folder,\n"
    2532             : "                             in which unparsed header files are stored.\n"
    2533             : "                             Note that the folder must be empty (or does not exist).\n"
    2534             : "                             If not specified, the default relative location _rose_ \n"
    2535             : "                             is used.\n"
    2536             : "     -rose:applicationRootDirectory DIRECTORYNAME\n"
    2537             : "                             A relative or an absolute path to the root folder,\n"
    2538             : "                             in which all application files will use for the unparsing \n"
    2539             : "                             of source files and header files. If not specified, the default \n"
    2540             : "                             location is the current directory. \n"
    2541             : "     -rose:unparse_in_same_directory_as_input_file\n"
    2542             : "                             Build the generated source file (unparse) in the same directory as \n"
    2543             : "                             the input source file.  This allows the backend compiler \n"
    2544             : "                             to compile the generated file exactly the same as the \n"
    2545             : "                             input would have been compiled (following original header file \n"
    2546             : "                             source path lookup rules precisely (this is rarely required)). \n"
    2547             : "     -rose:suppressConstantFoldingPostProcessing\n"
    2548             : "                             Optimization to avoid postprocessing phase in C code only\n"
    2549             : "                             This option has only shown an effect on the 2.5 million line\n"
    2550             : "                             wireshark application\n"
    2551             : "                             (not presently compatable with OpenMP or C++ code)\n"
    2552             : "     -rose:noclobber_output_file\n"
    2553             : "                             force error on rewrite of existing output file (default: false).\n"
    2554             : "     -rose:noclobber_if_different_output_file\n"
    2555             : "                             force error on rewrite of existing output file only if result\n"
    2556             : "                             if a different output file (default: false). \n"
    2557             : "     -rose:appendPID\n"
    2558             : "                             append PID into the temporary output name. \n"
    2559             : "                             This can avoid issues in parallel compilation (default: false). \n"
    2560             : "     -rose:unparse_tokens\n"
    2561             : "                             Unparses code using original token stream where possible.\n"
    2562             : "                             Only C/C++ are supported now. Fortran support is under development \n"
    2563             : "     -rose:unparse_using_leading_and_trailing_token_mappings \n"
    2564             : "                             unparses code using original token stream and forces the output \n"
    2565             : "                             of two files representing the unparsing of each statement using \n"
    2566             : "                             the token stream mapping to the AST.  The token_leading_* file \n"
    2567             : "                             uses the mapping and the leading whitespace mapping between \n"
    2568             : "                             statements, where as the token_trailing_* file uses the mapping \n"
    2569             : "                             and the trailing whitespace mapping between statements.  Both \n"
    2570             : "                             files should be identical, and the same as the input file. \n"
    2571             : "     -rose:unparse_template_ast\n"
    2572             : "                             unparse C++ templates from their AST, not from strings stored by EDG. \n"
    2573             : "\n"
    2574             : "Debugging options:\n"
    2575             : "     -rose:detect_dangling_pointers LEVEL \n"
    2576             : "                             detects references to previously deleted IR nodes in the AST\n"
    2577             : "                             (part of AST consistancy tests, default is false since some codes fail this test)\n"
    2578             : "                             LEVEL is one of:\n"
    2579             : "                               0: off (does not issue warning)\n"
    2580             : "                               1: on (issues warning with information)\n"
    2581             : "                               2: on (issues error and exists)\n"
    2582             : "\n"
    2583             : "Testing Options:\n"
    2584             : "     -rose:negative_test     test ROSE using input that is expected to fail\n"
    2585             : "                               (returns 0 if input test failed, else error if\n"
    2586             : "                               passed)\n"
    2587             : "     -rose:test LEVEL        limit parts of ROSE which are run\n"
    2588             : "                             LEVEL is one of:\n"
    2589             : "                               0: transparent (ROSE translator does nothing)\n"
    2590             : "                               1: run the KCC front end only (assumes it is in\n"
    2591             : "                                    path)\n"
    2592             : "                               2: run the newer version of EDG (compiled\n"
    2593             : "                                    separately from SAGE) 'edgFrontEnd'\n"
    2594             : "                                    (see\n"
    2595             : "                                    src/frontend/EDG/EDG_3.3/src/Makefile.am\n"
    2596             : "                                    for instructions on how to build EDG\n"
    2597             : "                                    without SAGE III)\n"
    2598             : "                               3: run internal (older) version of edg front end\n"
    2599             : "                                    (deprecated option)\n"
    2600             : "                               4: same as 3 plus parse into Sage III program\n"
    2601             : "                                    tree\n"
    2602             : "                               5: same as 4 plus unparse untransformed source\n"
    2603             : "                                    code\n"
    2604             : "                               6: same as 5 plus compile generated source code\n"
    2605             : "                               7: same as 5 plus build higher level grammars\n"
    2606             : "                                    before unparsing\n"
    2607             : "                               8: same as 6 plus run midend (transformations)\n"
    2608             : "                                    before unparsing\n"
    2609             : "\n"
    2610             : "Report bugs to <dquinlan@llnl.gov>.\n"
    2611             :   , stdout);
    2612             : 
    2613             :   // Obsolete options
    2614             :   // -sage:sage_backend            have EDG call the sage backend
    2615             :   // -sage:disable_cp_backend      prevent EDG from calling the cp backend
    2616             :   // -rose:outputGrammarTreeFiles  write out program tree representation in C++ grammar (useful for internal debugging)
    2617             :   // -rose:outputGrammarTreeFilesForHeaderFiles (include header files in above option (must be specified after above option)
    2618             : 
    2619             :   // DQ (5/20/2005): More obsolete options
    2620             :   // -edg:disable_edg_backend      prevent EDG from calling the sage backend
    2621             :   // -sage:disable_sage_backend    prevent EDG from calling the sage backend
    2622             :   // -sage:enable_cp_backend       have EDG call the cp backend

    3489             : 
    3490             :   // Fixed format v.s. free format option handling (ROSE defaults to fix or free format, depending on the file extension).
    3491             :   // F77 default is fixed format, F90 and later default is free format.
    3492             :   // Fortran source file format options for different compilers(for IBM/XL,Intel,Portland,GNU):
    3493             :   //     IBM/XL           Intel            Portland     GNU
    3494             :   //    -qfixed          -fixed           -Mfixed      -ffixed-form
    3495             :   //    -qfree           -free            -Mfree       -free-form
    3496             :   // GNU gfortran also supports -fno-fixed-form (we could use this to turn off all fixed form
    3497             :   // formatting independent of the input source).
    3498             : 
    3499             :   // DQ (12/10/2007): Set the defaul value depending on the version of fortran being used.

    3501             :         {
    3502             :        // For F77 and older versions of Fortran assume fixed format.
    3503             :        // set_fixedFormat(true);

    3509          31 :           set_backendCompileFormat(SgFile::e_fixed_form_output_format);

    3841             : 
    3842             :   // unparser language option
    3843             :   // DQ (8/27/2007): This option controls the output language (which language unparser is to be used).
    3844             :   // This allows the code generation of one language to be tested using input of another langauge.  It is
    3845             :   // mostly a mechanism to test the unparser in the early stages of their development. Unshared language
    3846             :   // constructs are not supported and would have the be translated.  This step does none of this sort of
    3847             :   // translation, which might be difficult debendingon the input and output languages selected.
    3848             :   // Supported options are:
    3849             :   //      e_default_output_language
    3850             :   //      e_C_output_language
    3851             :   //      e_Cxx_output_language
    3852             :   //      e_Fortran_output_language
    3853             :   // set_outputLanguage(SgFile::e_default_output_language);
    3854             :   // ROSE_ASSERT (get_outputLanguage() == SgFile::e_default_output_language);
    3855         714 :      if ( CommandlineProcessing::isOption(argv,"-rose:","C_output_language",true) == true )

    3866             :         }

    3990             : 
    3991             :   // DQ (3/24/2019): Adding support to translate comments and CPP directives into explicit IR nodes in the AST.
    3992             :   // This can simplify how transformations are done when intended to be a part of the token-baed unparsing.
    3993             :   //
    3994             :   // This translateCommentsAndDirectivesIntoAST option: When using the token based unparsing, and soemtime even
    3995             :   // if not, a greater degree of precisison in the unparsing is possible if new directives can be positioned into
    3996             :   // the AST with more precission relative to other directives that are already present.  This option adds the
    3997             :   // comments and CPP directives as explicit IR nodes in each scope where they can be added as such.
    3998             :   // This also has the advantage of making them more trivially availalbe in the analysis as well.
    3999             :   // This is however, not the default in ROSE, and it an experimental option that may be adopted more
    4000             :   // formally later if it can be demonstraed to be robust.
    4001             :   //
    4002         714 :      if ( CommandlineProcessing::isOption(argv,"-rose:","(translateCommentsAndDirectivesIntoAST)",true) == true )
    4003             :         {
    4004           0 :           printf ("option -rose:translateCommentsAndDirectivesIntoAST found \n");
    4005           0 :           set_translateCommentsAndDirectivesIntoAST(true);
    4006             :         }

    4035             :   // frequently machine specific and we are compiling then on architectures for which they were
    4036             :   // not designed.  This option allows then to be read, constructed in the AST to support analysis

    4098             :   // DQ (9/26/2011): Adding options to support internal debugging of ROSE based tools and language support.
    4099             :   // ****************
    4100             :   // DEBUGING SUPPORT
    4101             :   // ****************
    4102             :   //
    4103             :   // Support for detecting dangling pointers
    4104             :   //     This is the first level of this sort of support. This level will be fooled by any reuse of
    4105             :   //     the memory (from new allocations) previously deleted. A later leve of this option will disable
    4106             :   //     reuse of previously deleted memory for IR nodes; but it will consume more memory for translators
    4107             :   //     that delete a lot of IR nodes as part of there functionality.  I expect this to only seriously
    4108             :   //     make a difference for the AST merge operations which allocate and delete large parts of ASTs
    4109             :   //     frequently.
    4110             :   //     Note: this detects only dangling pointers to ROSE IR nodes, nothing more.
    4111             :   //
    4112             : #if 0
    4113             :   // Test ROSE using default level 2 (error that will cause assertion) when not specified via the command line.
    4114             :      set_detect_dangling_pointers(2);
    4115             : #endif

    4122             :              {
